(2024), contains visual elements such as structured tables with numerical results, charts, diagrams, and textual sections, demonstrating the multimodal complexity present in the dataset.
Figure 3:Distribution of top 25 topics for the posters in the dataset.

Figure 4:Illustration of ourSegment & Summarizepipeline. The poster, describing the work inRakitin et al. (2024), is first divided into segments, each of which is summarized by a MLLM. These localized summaries are subsequently merged by a text-based large language model to generate a single, coherent summary.

Figure 5:Effect of text present in the poster on summarization. We report mean ROUGE-L scores for different OCR-extracted character-length bins. The red dashed line represents the number of posters in each bin.
